The correct timeline is option A: 2 -> 1 -> 3 -> 4 -> 5.

The sequence starts with a static title slide (2), followed by the speaker saying "so that's the ideal solenoid" (1). Then, a close-up shot of a copper-colored solenoid appears (3), along with on-screen text explaining what a solenoid is. After this, there is a visual display of magnetic field lines around a solenoid (4), accompanied by the equation B = μ₀ n I. Finally, the speaker concludes the lecture (5).

Therefore, the order of events is: a static title slide, a description of the ideal solenoid, a visual depiction of a solenoid, a demonstration of the magnetic field around a solenoid, and a concluding statement from the speaker.

Answer: D: 1 -> 2 -> 4 -> 3 -> 6 -> 5 -> 7

This completes the sequence of events.
